info.title: Partner Directory
info.description:
Partner Directory enables you to get, write or delete data. This component contains information on partners that are connected to a tenant in the context of a larger network. Information stored in the Partner Directory can be used to parameterize integration flows.  
This API is implemented based on OData version 2 specification.

externalDocs.description: SAP Cloud Integration documentation: OData API - Partner Directory

x-sap-shortText: Access the Partner Directory to maintain and manage data.

x-servers.description: SAP Cloud Integration REST API Endpoint

Account Short Name.description: SAP BTP subaccount short name where Cloud Integration is provided

x-servers.description: SAP Cloud Integration Custom Domain Endpoint - see [Configuring Custom Domains](https://help.sap.com/viewer/368c481cd6954bdfa5d0435479fd4eaf/Cloud/en-US/7230b9ff41914cc0969223e6a020104b.html)

Custom Name.description: Your defined name for your Cloud Integration account.

get.description: You can use the following request to get all alternative partners.

parameters.name: $orderby
parameters.description: Order items by property values

parameters.name: $select
parameters.description: Select properties to be returned.

post.description:
You can use the following request to add new alternative partner.
In API sandbox only read APIs could be tested. You need to configure an API endpoint for your account, where you have the required write permissions to update the partner directory.

parameters.name: AlternativePartner
parameters.description: New entity
CSRF token that is valid for the current session (see resource 'CSRF Token Handling').
parameters.name: X-CSRF-Token

500.description: Internal server error - alternative partner already exists or the request body does not contain the required attributes.

message.value: Problem during creating an entity: Inserting Alternative Partner ID with ID <ID>, scheme <scheme>, and agency <agency> failed: Attempt to insert duplicate key row in object 'ITPD_ALTERNATIVE_PIDS' with unique index 'ITPD_ALTERNATIVE_PIDS_PK'

get.description: You can use the following request to get an alternative partner by key fields.
get.summary: Get alternative partner by key fields.

parameters.name: Hexagency
parameters.description:
Hexadecimal value in string format of the values for Agency
Example: ```4167656E637958595A```

parameters.name: Hexscheme
parameters.description:
Hexadecimal value in string format of the values for Schema
Example: ```4C4F4E47```

parameters.name: Hexid
parameters.description:
Hexadecimal value in string format of the values for Id
Example: ```5265636569766572205072656D69756D```

parameters.name: $select
parameters.description: Select properties to be returned.

put.description:
You can use the following request to update alternative partner.
In API sandbox only read APIs could be tested. You need to configure an API endpoint for your account, where you have the required write permissions to update the partner directory.

parameters.name: Hexagency
parameters.description:
Hexadecimal value in string format of the values for Agency
Example: ```4167656E637958595A```

parameters.name: Hexscheme
parameters.description:
Hexadecimal value in string format of the values for Schema
Example: ```4C4F4E47```

parameters.name: Hexid
parameters.description:
Hexadecimal values in string format of the values for Id
Example: ```5265636569766572205072656D69756D```

parameters.name: AlternativePartner
parameters.description: New property values
CSRF token that is valid for the current session (see resource 'CSRF Token Handling')
parameters.name: X-CSRF-Token

500.description: Internal server error - request body does not contain values for expected attributes.

message.value: Problem during updating an entity: Updating Alternative Partner ID with Id <Id>, Scheme <scheme>, and Agency <agency> failed: Attempt to insert NULL value into column 'PID', table 'NEO_7U7D8TZA5XSIZT879SZA6YF6Q.NEO_7U7D8TZA5XSIZT879SZA6YF6Q.ITPD_ALTERNATIVE_PIDS'; column does not allow nulls. Update fails.

get.description: You can use the following request to get all user credential parameters.

parameters.name: user
parameters.description: User which initiates the call

parameters.name: $filter
parameters.description:
Filter is required for partner identifier (Pid) with equals operator (eq).
Example: ```Pid eq 'Receiver_1'```

parameters.name: $select
parameters.description: Select properties to be returned.

500.description: Internal server error - required filter query parameter for partner ID is not correctly entered.

message.value: Filter 'Pid eq ''' is not supported in UserCredentialParameters query. Only filters of the form "$filter=Pid eq 'parterId1'" are supported.

post.description:
You can use the following request to add/update user credential parameter.
In API sandbox only read APIs could be tested. You need to configure an API endpoint for your account, where you have the required write permissions to update the partner directory.

parameters.name: UserCredentialParameter
parameters.description: New user credential parameter
CSRF token that is valid for the current session (see resource 'CSRF Token Handling')
parameters.name: X-CSRF-Token

500.description: Internal server error - request body does not contain the expected content.

message.value: Problem during creating an entity: The value of the property 'Password' is missing for the entity 'UserCredentialParameter'.

get.description: You can use the following request to get user credential parameter by key.
get.summary: Get user credential parameter by key.

parameters.name: Pid
parameters.description:
Internal identifier of a partner
Example: ```Receiver_1```

parameters.name: Id
parameters.description:
Internal identifier of a parameter
Example: ```USER```

parameters.name: returnHashedPassword
parameters.description: Select required hash format, if password should be returned.

parameters.name: $select
parameters.description: Select properties to be returned.

Example: ```Receiver_1```

parameters.name: Id

Example: ```USER```
CSRF token that is valid for the current session (see resource 'CSRF Token Handling')
parameters.name: X-CSRF-Token

get.description:
You can use the following request to request the CSRF token for this session, which is required for write access via POST, PUT and DELETE operations. Copy the received X-CSRF-Token from the response header.
**In API sandbox this request is not relevant!**

parameters.description: To retrieve a new CSRF token the value of the header must be set to ```Fetch```.
parameters.name: X-CSRF-Token

200.description: The header provides the CSRF token for this session.

X-CSRF-Token.description: CSRF token that can be used for all modifying requests within the same session.

top.name: $top
top.description: Show only the first n items.

204.description: No content. The server successfully processed the request and is not returning any content

400.description: Bad Request. Wrong format or structure of the provided request body or parameters.

401.description: Unauthorized. Authorization information is missing or invalid.

403.description: Forbidden. The required permissions to access the resource are missing.

404.description: Not found. The requested resource could not be found.

429.description: Too many requests. Servers rate limit exceeded.

500.description: Internal server error. The requested operation led to an error during execution.
